column4: I've had a corrupt GRUB when i uninstalled XP, so, i searched around, and came up with a solution ( http://paste.ubuntu.com/40407/ ) that solved the problem, but now, when i use gparted, gpart, i only see the hd without the partitions, and "unnasigned", although i can mount this partitions and access them. Now i want to use them since i don't have any space left in the current partition i'm using. If anyone, has any ideas, i'll be glad to w
sudo fdisk -l
I see them, i can use them.
did you boot from a livecd for running  gparted?
Both ways.
Everything works fine, it's just i can see them with gparted, or even with the livecdinstaller, or any.
And by don't see them, i mean i cant format them and use them, i can readwrite them.
sduo fdisk -l
What should i do after that?
pastebin the output?
http://pastebin.ubuntu.com/40408/
which one do you want to format?
everything but sd6 - sda7, in wich i have Ubuntu.
format or remove them?
i want to be able to use them as storage.
that doesn't answer my question
Remove them, and then be able to create a new one, altogheter
cfdisk and remove them
The thing is, when i open gparted, i only see the whole disk, as it was unnasigned.
did I tell you to use gparted?
That's something i've tried before.
and?
